name: Zaum Gadget
storyline: This 800K file is the only example of crossmedia psychotronic beliefware currently extant. The original program was found by Mr. Hardiker in Babelian ruins dated 9999 BC & deciphered from a since forgotten machine language. It is thought that Zaum Gadget was a subliminal event-structure capable of subtly manipulating the beliefs of any participant. A maze of twisted sound effects, extant texts, & interactive visuals.
summary:
Billed as an "interactive cyber event," this interactive hypercard stack is said to have been found by by creator Amendant Hardiker among some Babelian ruins dated back to 9999 BC, then deciphered from a since forgotten machine language. It is thought that Zaum Gadget was a subliminal event-structure capable of subtly manipulating the beliefs of any participant.

Inspired by Russian futurism, Zaum is a unique digital experience.
